intro: Stichorkis fargesii, commonly known as the Yunnan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
